lexUnit.name: prepare.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: make ready for use or consideration, or make or get ready to do or deal with something.

sentence.text: To prepare adequately for a marathon , I think you should allow 26 weeks if you are inexperienced and at least 12 weeks if you have run several .
You do not feel inhibited because you have n't prepared adequately or fear that other people might catch you out or ridicule you .
But I did n't prepare carefully enough .
The allegations broke on Tuesday as Jackson was preparing for the first of two concerts in Bangkok , the first stop in the Asian swing of his Dangerous world tour .

North Korea has not conducted a nuclear test , but in early May 2005 , press reports indicated that U.S. satellite imagery had detected signs that North Korea could be preparing for a nuclear test to be conducted in June .
Many analysts now believe the talks are dead , and in early May 2005 there were reports that Washington and Tokyo were preparing to refer the issue to the UN Security Council .
